definition: to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

sentences.english: AT YOUR SERVICE is the core value of Club Kopin ever and forever.
sentences.chinese: 为您服务永远是酷品公司秉持的核心价值观。

sentences.english: This relationship is the fundamental idea of postmodern literary criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这种关系正是后现代文艺评论秉持的基础理念。

sentences.english: All people who live good lives, no matter what their religion, have a place in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 一切行善之人，不论秉持何种信仰，皆于天堂有份。

sentences.english: I am a good citizen who always live by societal moral standards.
sentences.chinese: 我是一个好公民，总是秉持着社会道德标准来生活。

sentences.english: China always upholds the principle of mutual benefit on an equal footing in trade and economic cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 中国开展对外经贸合作一直秉持平等互利原则。

sentences.english: Once you choose that attitude, you can discover the truth.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你秉持这种态度，你便会发现真相。

sentences.english: There are four elements in the work of interpreting Chinese ancient poetry.
sentences.chinese: 中国古典诗词译解方法亦秉持这种态度。

sentences.english: Now, she is still continued to service for the children well.
sentences.chinese: 现在，仍然秉持着“童心母爱”继续为孩子们服务。

sentences.english: But with faith, The choice is an easy one.
sentences.chinese: 但当我们秉持着信念，做出选择是很简单的事。

sentences.english: A leader should adhere to the principle of justice, and can not act according to his own preference.
sentences.chinese: 做领导就要秉持公心，不能以个人好恶行事。

sentences.english: China always abides by such principles when communicating with relevant countries.
sentences.chinese: 中方在与有关国家沟通时一直秉持有关原则。

definition: to take orders/to receive commands/to carry on (a tradition)
based on.../in conformance with../taking as one's main principle
to advocate/to initiate/to propose/to be a proponent of (an idea or school of thought)
to follow through/to carry through to the end
to implement/to put into practice/to carry out
